result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalmer J Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
State by Suleski /  Def in custody w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Cts 1 & 3 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  Plea is FVI made - sufficient factual basis exists - CRT finds def guilty
Ct 2 - Dismissed & read-in
O'Neil:  def unable to get State ID because of mix-up on birth cert.
CRT:  you can accomplish this w/ a name change - I will have my clerk fill out the form & waive the fee & you can get it done now
Form prepared - CRT notarizes def's signature - case # has to be given
CRT to clerk:  take downstaires & file it - I will waive his filing fee because it is name on his birth cerrt. - I'm going to dispense w/ the obligation of publication & when you're out of jail & done here, CRT needs def to come back  into this bldg & we'll do your name change this afternoon & then you can take that to DMV to get the ID - you need to come back to my office this afternoon
CRT'S SENTENCE:  18 days CJ w/18 days credit - TIME SERVED, on both Cts concurrent;  Def to pay costs on both Cts - converted to a Civil Judgment
CRT:  bring def back up for name change sometime this afternoon - after you're done w/ Intake
$250 Sig bond signed by def on 5-15-15 w/ no conditions
